study.description: A Study is a container for a sequencing investigation that may comprise multiple experiments. The Study has an overall goal, but is otherwise minimally defined in the SRA.  A Study is composed of a descriptor, zero or more experiments, and zero or more analyses. The submitter may decorate the Study with web links and properties.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for a study. This is used to link experiments to the study.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the study as would be used in a publication.

fields.name: study_type
fields.description: The STUDY_TYPE presents a controlled vocabulary for expressing the overall purpose of the study.

fields.name: new_study_type
fields.description: Optional if 'study_type' is not 'other'. To propose a new term, select Other and enter a new study type.

fields.name: study_abstract
fields.description: Briefly describes the goals, purpose, and scope of the Study.  This need not be listed if it can be inherited from a referenced publication.

experiment.description: An experiment object serves as a metadata record encapsulating essential details about a sequencing experiment, including the experimental design, sequencing type, and relevant parameters. This information enhances the interpretation and contextual understanding of nucleotide sequences submitted to the archive.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each experiment. This is used to link runs to experiments.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Short text that can be used to call out experiment records in searches or in displays. This element is technically optional but should be used for all new records.

fields.name: study_alias
fields.description: Identifies the parent study. (From study metadata)

fields.name: sample_alias
fields.description: (From sample metadata)

fields.name: design_description
fields.description: Goal and setup of the individual library including library was constructed.

fields.name: library_name
fields.description: The submitter's name for this library.

fields.name: library_strategy
fields.description: Sequencing technique intended for this library.

fields.name: library_source
fields.description: The LIBRARY_SOURCE specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced.

fields.name: library_selection
fields.description: Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation

fields.name: library_layout
fields.description: LIBRARY_LAYOUT specifies whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads. In the case of paired reads, information about the relative distance and orientation is specified.

fields.name: insert_size
fields.description: Insert size for paired reads

fields.name: library_construction_protocol
fields.description: Free form text describing the protocol by which the sequencing library was constructed.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The PLATFORM record selects which sequencing platform and platform-specific runtime parameters. This will be determined by the Center. optional if 'instrument_model' is provided.

fields.name: instrument_model
fields.description: Model of the sequencing instrument.

run.description: A run contains a group of reads generated for a particular experiment.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each run.

fields.name: experiment_alias
fields.description: From_experiment_metadata

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: The name or relative pathname of a run data file.

fields.name: file_format
fields.description: The run data file model.

sample.description: A Sample defines an isolate of sequenceable material upon which sequencing experiments can be based.  The Sample object may be a surrogate for taxonomy accession or an anonymized individual identifier.  Or, it may fully specify provenance and isolation method of the starting material.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each sample.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Short text that can be used to call out sample records in search results or in displays.

fields.name: taxon_id
fields.description: NCBI Taxonomy Identifier.  This is appropriate for individual organisms and some environmental samples.

fields.name: sample_description
fields.description: Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.

fields.name: observed biotic relationship
fields.description: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with. E.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y. The target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object.

fields.name: propagation
fields.description: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

fields.name: sample collection method
fields.description: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

fields.name: sample storage temperature
fields.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

fields.name: sample storage location
fields.description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room. Indicate the location name.

fields.name: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
fields.description: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

fields.name: soil_taxonomic/local classification
fields.description: soil classification based on local soil classification system

fields.name: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
fields.description: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

fields.name: soil type
fields.description: Description of the soil type or classification. This field accepts terms under soil (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001998). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

fields.name: soil type method
fields.description: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

fields.name: soil texture measurement
fields.description: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

fields.name: soil texture method
fields.description: reference or method used in determining soil texture

fields.name: soil pH
fields.description: pH measurement of the soil; e.g. 6.2

fields.name: growth facility
fields.description: type of facility where the sampled plant was grown

fields.name: plant developmental stage
fields.description: developmental stage at the time of sample collection; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v 20) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. hypocotyl emergence stage (PO_0007043)

fields.name: sampled age
fields.description: age of subject at the time of sample collection; relevant scale depends on species and study; e.g. 2 weeks old

fields.name: sample health state
fields.description: health status of the subject at the time of sample collection

fields.name: sample wet mass
fields.description: measurement of wet mass at the time of sample collection; e.g. 0.23 g

fields.name: sample disease stage
fields.description: stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen

fields.name: sample length
fields.description: length of subject at the time of sampling, if different from the height; e.g. 2m

fields.name: sample height
fields.description: height of subject at the time of sampling, if different from the length; e.g. 0.75m

fields.name: sample dry mass
fields.description: measurement of dry mass at the time of sample collection; e.g. 0.05g

fields.name: sample disease status
fields.description: list of diseases with which the subject has been diagnosed at the time of sample collection; can include multiple diagnoses; the value of the field depends on subject; e.g. Charcoal rot (Macrophomina phaseolina), Late wilt (Cephalosporium maydis)

fields.name: sample phenotype
fields.description: phenotype of the plant from which the sample was obtained, such as colour of corolla, fruit diameter, circular leaf shape; Plant Trait Ontology (TO), Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), or other ontology is recommended; e.g. stem epidermis colour (TO:1000018)

fields.name: ploidy
fields.description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

fields.name: number of replicons
fields.description: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

fields.name: extrachromosomal elements
fields.description: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

fields.name: estimated size
fields.description: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

fields.name: collected_by
fields.description: name of persons or institute who collected the specimen

fields.name: collection date
fields.description: The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.
fields.regex: (^[12][0-9]{3}(-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])(-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?(/[0-9]{4}(-[0-9]{2}(-[0-9]{2}(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?)?$)|(^not applicable$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$)

fields.name: altitude
fields.description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.
fields.regex: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$))

fields.name: geographic location (latitude)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
fields.regex: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not applicable$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$)

fields.name: geographic location (longitude)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
fields.regex: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not applicable$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$)

fields.name: geographic location (region and locality)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

fields.name: identified_by
fields.description: name of the expert who identified the specimen taxonomically

fields.name: broad-scale environmental context
fields.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

fields.name: local environmental context
fields.description: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

fields.name: elevation
fields.description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.
fields.regex: ([+-]?(0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$))

fields.name: amount or size of sample collected
fields.description: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

fields.name: sampling time point
fields.description: Time point at which a sample or observation is made or taken from a biomaterial as measured from some reference point. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.

fields.name: sample capture status
fields.description: Reason for the sample collection.
cv: active surveillance in response to outbreak
active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak

fields.name: organism common name
fields.description: common name of the subject organism, e.g. maize

fields.name: biological status
fields.description: the level of genome modification; controlled vocabulary: wild, natural, semi-natural, inbred line, breeder's line, hybrid, clonal selection, mutant

fields.name: growth habit
fields.description: characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species

fields.name: plant sex
fields.description: sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistilate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite

fields.name: plant structure
fields.description: name of plant structure that the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) terms see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051); if an individual flower is sampled the sex of it can be recorded here

fields.name: sample storage duration
fields.description: Duration for which the sample was stored. Indicate the duration for which the sample was stored written in ISO 8601 format.

fields.name: geographic location (country and/or sea)
fields.description: The geographical origin of where the sample was collected from, with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
cv: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

fields.name: climate environment
fields.description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

fields.name: gaseous environment
fields.description: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

fields.name: seasonal environment
fields.description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

fields.name: drainage classification
fields.description: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

fields.name: source material identifiers
fields.description: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

fields.name: source material description
fields.description: further information to clarify the nature of the specimen or population used that is not collected elsewhere, e.g. if source was derived from accessioned stock, describe how it links to the original material

fields.name: perturbation
fields.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

fields.name: genotype
fields.description: name or code for genotype of organism

fields.name: genetic modification
fields.description: A genetic modification of the genome of an organism which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means. Examples of genetic modification include specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

fields.name: subspecific genetic lineage rank
fields.description: further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e. variety, cultivar, ecotype, inbred line,; it can also contain alternative taxonomic information

fields.name: subspecific genetic lineage name
fields.description: name of the infraspecific rank, e.g ecotype Col-0

fields.name: organism phenotype
fields.description: most relevant phenotypic traits of the subject; for Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO, e.g. bifurcated (PATO_0001784); terms from Trait Ontology (TO), Plant Ontology (PO) or Crop Ontology (CO) are also accepted; include name/method/scale for each trait; can include multiple traits

fields.name: ancestral data
fields.description: information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

fields.name: plant growth medium
fields.description: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147).

fields.name: rooting conditions
fields.description: relevant rooting conditions, such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container

fields.name: culture rooting medium
fields.description: name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium, can be a name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium; e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium, if the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors

fields.name: rooting medium macronutrients
fields.description: measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170mg/L)

fields.name: rooting medium micronutrients
fields.description: measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2mg/L)

fields.name: rooting medium organic supplements
fields.description: organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitaimins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal; e.g. Nicotinic acid (0.5mg/L)

fields.name: rooting medium carbon
fields.description: source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose

fields.name: rooting medium regulators
fields.description: growth regulators in the culture rooting medium, such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid; e.g. 0.5mg/L NAA

fields.name: rooting medium solidifier
fields.description: specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar

fields.name: rooting medium pH
fields.description: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5

fields.name: isolation and growth condition
fields.description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

fields.name: sample material processing
fields.description: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

fields.name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
fields.description: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

fields.name: depth
fields.description: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
fields.regex: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$))

fields.name: air temperature regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens

fields.name: antibiotic regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens

fields.name: chemical mutagen
fields.description: treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens

fields.name: fertilizer administration
fields.description: Type of fertilizer or amendment added to the soil or water for the purpose of improving substrate health and quality for plant growth. This field accepts terms listed under agronomic fertilizer (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00002062). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order. N.B. Old ENA definition as "fertilizer regimen": information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens

fields.name: fungicide regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

fields.name: gravity
fields.description: information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments

fields.name: growth hormone regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

fields.name: herbicide regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

fields.name: humidity regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

fields.name: mineral nutrient regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens

fields.name: non-mineral nutrient regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

fields.name: pesticide regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

fields.name: pH regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

fields.name: radiation regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple radiation regimens

fields.name: rainfall regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

fields.name: salt regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

fields.name: standing water regimen
fields.description: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

fields.name: watering regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

fields.name: water temperature regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

fields.name: plant treatment
fields.description: ontology term(s) that describes the plant treatment or relevant environmental conditions, recommend use of Plant Environment Ontology (EO) or other ontology, such as XEML Environment Ontology (XEO) or Crop Ontology (CO), more specific fields in the treatment section can be used in addition to or in place of this field

fields.name: light regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to light, this includes both light intensity and quality

fields.name: biotic regimen
fields.description: information about treatment involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi

fields.name: mechanical damage
fields.description: information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

fields.name: chemical administration
fields.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI
